lead_paragraph: Chosen by the Art Students League for inclusion in a public art program, Aaron Bell designed a piece that depicted a human body with a noose in place of the head. The parks department rejected it.

headline.main: A ‘Problematic’ Sculpture Is Silenced by New York Parks Officials

snippet: Chosen by the Art Students League for inclusion in a public art program, Aaron Bell designed a piece that depicted a human body with a noose in place of the head. The parks department rejected it.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column recounts ongoing struggle by African-American sculptor Aaron Bell to get his message of racial intolerance heard; Bell won Art Students League Model to Monument competition for his work, Stand Loud, Stand Tall; piece was slated for setup in public area near West 68th Street but parks department has objected to sculpture because it contains image of noose.
